intro: Paepalanthus anceps, commonly known as the Brazilian sunflower, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and savannas. It has a robust, upright stem with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The flowers are arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family, and bloom during the warmer months.
